get.description: Gets all the Event Hubs in a Namespace.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Skip is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skip parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: May be used to limit the number of results to the most recent N usageDetails.

get.description: Gets the details of an EventHub schema group.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to create an Event Hub resource.

primaryConnectionString.description: Primary connection string of the created namespace AuthorizationRule.

secondaryConnectionString.description: Secondary connection string of the created namespace AuthorizationRule.

aliasPrimaryConnectionString.description: Primary connection string of the alias if GEO DR is enabled

aliasSecondaryConnectionString.description: Secondary  connection string of the alias if GEO DR is enabled

primaryKey.description: A base64-encoded 256-bit primary key for signing and validating the SAS token.

secondaryKey.description: A base64-encoded 256-bit primary key for signing and validating the SAS token.

keyName.description: A string that describes the AuthorizationRule.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

ApplicationGroupListResult.description: The response of a ApplicationGroup list operation.

value.description: The ApplicationGroup items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

ApplicationGroupPolicy.description: Properties of the Application Group policy

isEnabled.description: Determines if Application Group is allowed to create connection with namespace or not. Once the isEnabled is set to false, all the existing connections of application group gets dropped and no new connections will be allowed

clientAppGroupIdentifier.description: The Unique identifier for application group.Supports SAS(SASKeyName=KeyName) or AAD(AADAppID=Guid)

policies.description: List of group policies that define the behavior of application group. The policies can support resource governance scenarios such as limiting ingress or egress traffic.

ArmDisasterRecovery.description: Single item in List or Get Alias(Disaster Recovery configuration) operation

properties.description: Properties required to the Create Or Update Alias(Disaster Recovery configurations)

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

ArmDisasterRecoveryListResult.description: The response of a ArmDisasterRecovery list operation.

value.description: The ArmDisasterRecovery items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

ArmDisasterRecoveryProperties.description: Properties required to the Create Or Update Alias(Disaster Recovery configurations)

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the Alias(Disaster Recovery configuration) - possible values 'Accepted' or 'Succeeded' or 'Failed'

partnerNamespace.description: ARM Id of the Primary/Secondary eventhub namespace name, which is part of GEO DR pairing

alternateName.description: Alternate name specified when alias and namespace names are same.

role.description: role of namespace in GEO DR - possible values 'Primary' or 'PrimaryNotReplicating' or 'Secondary'

pendingReplicationOperationsCount.description: Number of entities pending to be replicated.

AuthorizationRule.description: Single item in a List or Get AuthorizationRule operation

properties.description: Properties supplied to create or update AuthorizationRule

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

AuthorizationRuleListResult.description: The response of a AuthorizationRule list operation.

value.description: The AuthorizationRule items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

AuthorizationRuleProperties.description: Properties supplied to create or update AuthorizationRule

rights.description: The rights associated with the rule.

AvailableCluster.description: Pre-provisioned and readily available Event Hubs Cluster count per region.

AvailableClustersList.description: The response of the List Available Clusters operation.

value.description: The count of readily available and pre-provisioned Event Hubs Clusters per region.

CaptureDescription.description: Properties to configure capture description for eventhub

enabled.description: A value that indicates whether capture description is enabled.

encoding.description: Enumerates the possible values for the encoding format of capture description. Note: 'AvroDeflate' will be deprecated in New API Version

intervalInSeconds.description: The time window allows you to set the frequency with which the capture to Azure Blobs will happen, value should between 60 to 900 seconds

sizeLimitInBytes.description: The size window defines the amount of data built up in your Event Hub before an capture operation, value should be between 10485760 to 524288000 bytes

destination.description: Properties of Destination where capture will be stored. (Storage Account, Blob Names)

skipEmptyArchives.description: A value that indicates whether to Skip Empty Archives

CaptureIdentity.description: A value that indicates whether capture description is enabled.

type.description: Type of Azure Active Directory Managed Identity.

userAssignedIdentity.description: ARM ID of Managed User Identity. This property is required is the type is UserAssignedIdentity. If type is SystemAssigned, then the System Assigned Identity Associated with the namespace will be used.

CaptureIdentityType.description: Type of Azure Active Directory Managed Identity.

CheckNameAvailabilityParameter.description: Parameter supplied to check Namespace name availability operation

name.description: Name to check the namespace name availability

CheckNameAvailabilityResult.description: The Result of the CheckNameAvailability operation

message.description: The detailed info regarding the reason associated with the Namespace.

nameAvailable.description: Value indicating Namespace is availability, true if the Namespace is available; otherwise, false.

reason.description: The reason for unavailability of a Namespace.

CleanupPolicyRetentionDescription.description: Enumerates the possible values for cleanup policy

Cluster.description: Single Event Hubs Cluster resource in List or Get operations.

properties.description: Event Hubs Cluster properties supplied in responses in List or Get operations.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

allOf.title: Resource
allOf.description: Common fields that are returned in the response for all Azure Resource Manager resources

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. Ex - /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

ClusterListResult.description: The response of a Cluster list operation.

value.description: The Cluster items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

ClusterProperties.description: Event Hubs Cluster properties supplied in responses in List or Get operations.

createdAt.description: The UTC time when the Event Hubs Cluster was created.

updatedAt.description: The UTC time when the Event Hubs Cluster was last updated.

metricId.description: The metric ID of the cluster resource. Provided by the service and not modifiable by the user.

supportsScaling.description: A value that indicates whether Scaling is Supported.

ClusterQuotaConfigurationProperties.description: Contains all settings for the cluster.

settings.description: All possible Cluster settings - a collection of key/value paired settings which apply to quotas and configurations imposed on the cluster.

ClusterSku.description: SKU parameters particular to a cluster instance.

capacity.description: The quantity of Event Hubs Cluster Capacity Units contained in this cluster.

mode.description: Setting to Enable or Disable Confidential Compute

ConsumerGroup.description: Single item in List or Get Consumer group operation

properties.description: Single item in List or Get Consumer group operation

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

ConsumerGroupListResult.description: The response of a ConsumerGroup list operation.

value.description: The ConsumerGroup items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

ConsumerGroupProperties.description: Single item in List or Get Consumer group operation

createdAt.description: Exact time the message was created.

updatedAt.description: The exact time the message was updated.

userMetadata.description: User Metadata is a placeholder to store user-defined string data with maximum length 1024. e.g. it can be used to store descriptive data, such as list of teams and their contact information also user-defined configuration settings can be stored.

DefaultAction.description: Default Action for Network Rule Set

Destination.description: Capture storage details for capture description

identity.description: A value that indicates whether capture description is enabled.

properties.description: Properties describing the storage account, blob container and archive name format for capture destination

DestinationProperties.description: Properties describing the storage account, blob container and archive name format for capture destination

storageAccountResourceId.description: Resource id of the storage account to be used to create the blobs

archiveNameFormat.description: Blob naming convention for archive, e.g. {Namespace}/{EventHub}/{PartitionId}/{Year}/{Month}/{Day}/{Hour}/{Minute}/{Second}. Here all the parameters (Namespace,EventHub .. etc) are mandatory irrespective of order

dataLakeSubscriptionId.description: Subscription Id of Azure Data Lake Store

dataLakeAccountName.description: The Azure Data Lake Store name for the captured events

dataLakeFolderPath.description: The destination folder path for the captured events

EHNamespace.description: Single Namespace item in List or Get Operation

properties.description: Namespace properties supplied for create namespace operation.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

EHNamespaceIdContainer.description: The full ARM ID of an Event Hubs Namespace

EHNamespaceIdListResult.description: The response of the List Namespace IDs operation

value.description: Result of the List Namespace IDs operation

EHNamespaceListResult.description: The response of a EHNamespace list operation.

value.description: The EHNamespace items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

EHNamespaceProperties.description: Namespace properties supplied for create namespace operation.

minimumTlsVersion.description: The minimum TLS version for the cluster to support, e.g. '1.2'

createdAt.description: The time the Namespace was created.

updatedAt.description: The time the Namespace was updated.

serviceBusEndpoint.description: Endpoint you can use to perform Service Bus operations.

clusterArmId.description: Cluster ARM ID of the Namespace.

isAutoInflateEnabled.description: Value that indicates whether AutoInflate is enabled for eventhub namespace.

publicNetworkAccess.description: This determines if traffic is allowed over public network. By default it is enabled.

maximumThroughputUnits.description: Upper limit of throughput units when AutoInflate is enabled, value should be within 0 to 20 throughput units. ( '0' if AutoInflateEnabled = true)

kafkaEnabled.description: Value that indicates whether Kafka is enabled for eventhub namespace.

zoneRedundant.description: Enabling this property creates a Standard Event Hubs Namespace in regions supported availability zones.

disableLocalAuth.description: This property disables SAS authentication for the Event Hubs namespace.

alternateName.description: Alternate name specified when alias and namespace names are same.

geoDataReplication.description: Geo Data Replication settings for the namespace

EncodingCaptureDescription.description: Enumerates the possible values for the encoding format of capture description. Note: 'AvroDeflate' will be deprecated in New API Version

keySource.description: Enumerates the possible value of keySource for Encryption

EndPointProvisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the Private Endpoint Connection.

EntityStatus.description: Enumerates the possible values for the status of the Event Hub.

ErrorAdditionalInfo.description: The resource management error additional info.

ErrorResponse.description: Error response indicates Event Hub service is not able to process the incoming request. The reason is provided in the error message.

value.description: The Eventhub items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

Eventhub.description: Single item in List or Get Event Hub operation

properties.description: Properties supplied to the Create Or Update Event Hub operation.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

allOf.title: Proxy Resource
allOf.description: The resource model definition for a Azure Resource Manager proxy resource. It will not have tags and a location

EventhubProperties.description: Properties supplied to the Create Or Update Event Hub operation.

partitionIds.description: Current number of shards on the Event Hub.

createdAt.description: Exact time the Event Hub was created.

updatedAt.description: The exact time the message was updated.

messageRetentionInDays.description: Number of days to retain the events for this Event Hub, value should be 1 to 7 days

partitionCount.description: Number of partitions created for the Event Hub, allowed values are from 1 to 32 partitions.

status.description: Enumerates the possible values for the status of the Event Hub.

identifier.description: Denotes the unique identifier for event hub and is generated by service while creating topic. This identifier can be used in kafka runtime apis wherever a UUID is required e.g Fetch & Delete Topic. This identifier is not supported in AMQP runtime operations yet.

userMetadata.description: Gets and Sets Metadata of User.

primaryLocation.description: Query parameter for the new primary location after failover.

force.description: If Force is false then graceful failover is attempted after ensuring no data loss. If Force flag is set to true, Forced failover is attempted with possible data loss.

maxReplicationLagDurationInSeconds.description: The maximum acceptable lag for data replication operations from the primary replica to a quorum of secondary replicas.  When the lag exceeds the configured amount, operations on the primary replica will be failed. The allowed values are 0 and 5 minutes to 1 day.

locations.description: A list of regions where replicas of the namespace are maintained.

Identity.description: Properties to configure Identity for Bring your Own Keys

keyName.description: Name of the Key from KeyVault

timestampType.description: Denotes the type of timestamp the message will hold.Two types of timestamp types - "AppendTime" and "CreateTime". AppendTime refers the time in which message got appended inside broker log. CreateTime refers to the time in which the message was generated on source side and producers can set this timestamp while sending the message. Default value is AppendTime. If you are using AMQP protocol, CreateTime equals AppendTime and its behavior remains the same.

MetricId.description: Metric Id on which the throttle limit should be set, MetricId can be discovered by hovering over Metric in the Metrics section of Event Hub Namespace inside Azure Portal

Mode.description: Setting to Enable or Disable Confidential Compute

NWRuleSetIpRules.description: The response from the List namespace operation.

NWRuleSetVirtualNetworkRules.description: The response from the List namespace operation.

ignoreMissingVnetServiceEndpoint.description: Value that indicates whether to ignore missing Vnet Service Endpoint

locationName.description: Azure regions where a replica of the namespace is maintained

clusterArmId.description: Optional property that denotes the ARM ID of the Cluster. This is required, if a namespace replica should be placed in a Dedicated Event Hub Cluster

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

value.description: The NetworkRuleSet items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

trustedServiceAccessEnabled.description: Value that indicates whether Trusted Service Access is Enabled or not.

defaultAction.description: Default Action for Network Rule Set

publicNetworkAccess.description: This determines if traffic is allowed over public network. By default it is enabled. If value is SecuredByPerimeter then Inbound and Outbound communication is controlled by the network security perimeter and profile's access rules.

id.description: Fully qualified identifier of the resource

NetworkSecurityPerimeterConfiguration.description: Network Security Perimeter related configurations of a given namespace

properties.description: Properties of the Network Security Perimeter Configuration

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

NetworkSecurityPerimeterConfigurationLis.description: Result of the List NetworkSecurityPerimeterConfiguration operation.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of NetworkSecurityPerimeter configuration propagation

provisioningIssues.description: List of Provisioning Issues if any

isBackingResource.description: True if the EventHub namespace is backed by another Azure resource and not visible to end users.

applicableFeatures.description: Indicates that the NSP controls related to backing association are only applicable to a specific feature in backing resource's data plane.

accessMode.description: Access Mode of the resource association

NetworkSecurityPerimeterConfigurationPro.description: Provisioning state of NetworkSecurityPerimeter configuration propagation

NspAccessRule.description: Information of Access Rule in Network Profile

id.description: Fully qualified identifier of the resource

addressPrefixes.description: Address prefixes in the CIDR format for inbound rules

Operation.description: A Event Hub REST API operation

isDataAction.description: Indicates whether the operation is a data action

operation.description: Localized friendly name for the operation

description.description: Localized friendly description for the operation

value.description: The Operation items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

value.description: The PrivateEndpointConnection items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

PrivateEndpointConnectionProperties.description: Properties of the private endpoint connection resource.

privateEndpoint.description: The Private Endpoint resource for this Connection.

privateLinkServiceConnectionState.description: Details about the state of the connection.

provisioningState.description: Provisioning state of the Private Endpoint Connection.

PrivateLinkResource.description: Information of the private link resource.

properties.description: Properties of the private link resource.

id.description: Fully qualified identifier of the resource.

groupId.description: The private link resource group id.

requiredMembers.description: The private link resource required member names.

requiredZoneNames.description: The private link resource Private link DNS zone name.

value.description: The PrivateLinkResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

ProvisioningIssue.description: Describes Provisioning issue for given NetworkSecurityPerimeterConfiguration

ProvisioningStateDR.description: Provisioning state of the Alias(Disaster Recovery configuration) - possible values 'Accepted' or 'Succeeded' or 'Failed'

RegenerateAccessKeyParameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Regenerate Authorization Rule operation, specifies which key needs to be reset.

key.description: Optional, if the key value provided, is set for KeyType or autogenerated Key value set for keyType

ResourceAssociationAccessMode.description: Access Mode of the resource association

RetentionDescription.description: Properties to configure retention settings for the  eventhub

cleanupPolicy.description: Enumerates the possible values for cleanup policy

retentionTimeInHours.description: Number of hours to retain the events for this Event Hub. This should be positive value upto namespace SKU max. -1 is a special case where retention time is infinite, but the size of an entity is restricted and its size depends on namespace SKU type.

minCompactionLagTimeInMinutes.description: The minimum time a message will remain ineligible for compaction in the log. This value is used when cleanupPolicy is Compact or DeleteOrCompact.

tombstoneRetentionTimeInHours.description: Number of hours to retain the tombstone markers of a compacted Event Hub. This value is used when cleanupPolicy is Compact or DeleteOrCompact. Consumer must complete reading the tombstone marker within this specified amount of time if consumer begins from starting offset to ensure they get a valid snapshot for the specific key described by the tombstone marker within the compacted Event Hub

RoleDisasterRecovery.description: role of namespace in GEO DR - possible values 'Primary' or 'PrimaryNotReplicating' or 'Secondary'

SchemaGroup.description: Single item in List or Get Schema Group operation

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

SchemaGroupListResult.description: The response of a SchemaGroup list operation.

value.description: The SchemaGroup items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

updatedAtUtc.description: Exact time the Schema Group was updated

createdAtUtc.description: Exact time the Schema Group was created.

groupProperties.description: dictionary object for SchemaGroup group properties

Sku.description: SKU parameters supplied to the create namespace operation

tier.description: The billing tier of this particular SKU.

capacity.description: The Event Hubs throughput units for Basic or Standard tiers, where value should be 0 to 20 throughput units. The Event Hubs premium units for Premium tier, where value should be 0 to 10 premium units.

SkuTier.description: The billing tier of this particular SKU.

id.description: Resource ID of Virtual Network Subnet

rateLimitThreshold.description: The Threshold limit above which the application group will be throttled.Rate limit is always per second.

metricId.description: Metric Id on which the throttle limit should be set, MetricId can be discovered by hovering over Metric in the Metrics section of Event Hub Namespace inside Azure Portal

TimestampType.description: Denotes the type of timestamp the message will hold.Two types of timestamp types - "AppendTime" and "CreateTime". AppendTime refers the time in which message got appended inside broker log. CreateTime refers to the time in which the message was generated on source side and producers can set this timestamp while sending the message. Default value is AppendTime. If you are using AMQP protocol, CreateTime equals AppendTime and its behavior remains the same.

TlsVersion.description: The minimum TLS version for the cluster to support, e.g. '1.2'

UnavailableReason.description: Specifies the reason for the unavailability of the service.

principalId.description: Principal Id of user assigned identity

clientId.description: Client Id of user assigned identity

userAssignedIdentity.description: ARM ID of user Identity selected for encryption
